Details:
* **Type**: String
* * Name of the Kubernetes cluster for which you want to set up HA.

* **Type**: boolean
* Set the variable to ``true`` to enable HA for the Kubernetes cluster.
* **Accepted values**: ``true`` or ``false``

* **Type**: string
* This is mandatory when ``k8s_enable_ha`` is set to ``true``. 
* This parameter captures the virtual IP address of the admin network.
* Ensure that the virtual IP is not assigned to any node in the cluster.
* **Example**: ``10.11.255.10``

* **Type**: IP address
* Omnia uses kube-vip as the default loadbalancer. If you want to use your own loadbalancer, provide its IP address here.
* This IP address must be different from the virtual IP addresses.

* **Type**: Integer
* This variable is mandatory if ``external_loadbalancer_ip`` is specified.
* The port must not be in use and cannot be 6443.

* **Type**: Comma-separated list
* This variable is mandatory if ``enable_k8s_ha`` is set to ``true``
* This captures the ist of service tags of active Kubernetes compute nodes. 
* You can add separate tags separated by commas.
